entry.title: Bringing Back Badges to Reward Q&A Experts!
entry.content:
If you‚Äôve been a long-time member of SAP Community, you‚Äôve probably accumulated several badges over the years. Even newer members may have earned the basic one-time badges available on our current platform ‚Äì such as the badge for taking our tutorial and the various badges awarded for a first-time action (e.g., replying, leaving a kudo). Members haven‚Äôt, however, been able to receive ongoing recognition for repeated activity.

That will change starting tomorrow (Tuesday, August 19).

With our previous gamification system, we rewarded badges for posting quality content, providing helpful answers, and more ‚Äì giving members the opportunity to earn multiple awards for frequent participation. (As an example, take a look at my list of badges ‚Äì which pales compared to the accomplishments of veterans who have been around since the earliest days of our online community!) As of August 19, we‚Äôre bringing this recognition back, starting with progression badges based on the number of answers accepted as solutions.

If you like answering questions (and you‚Äôre gifted at helping other members find solutions to their problems), then you‚Äôve probably already received the first badge in this new series ‚Äì by giving an answer that was accepted as a solution. Now you can earn an additional four badges, depending on the number of solutions you provided in Q&A.

We‚Äôll be rewarding people retroactively, so depending on your Q&A activity and length of community membership (going back to previous community platforms), you may get one or more badges tomorrow.

Not sure of your numbers? You can find them in your community content area. After logging in, click on the person icon in the upper right of any community page, then select ‚ÄúMy content.‚Äù

You‚Äôll see your total number of answers in the Private Stats section at the bottom of your ‚ÄúMy content‚Äù area.

But remember: an answer is not a solution. An answer becomes a solution when someone accepts it as the correct answer to a question. You‚Äôll find your total number of solutions in the gray box at the top of your ‚ÄúMy content‚Äù page.

So in this example, this member should expect to get all four of the new solutions badges. With 93 solutions, he has achieved the necessary criteria for the second badge (2 solutions), third badge (5 solutions), fourth badge (25 solutions), and the fifth and final badge in this progression series (50 solutions). (I sure hope he‚Äôs reading this, so he won‚Äôt wonder what‚Äôs going on when he sees four badge notifications tomorrow.)

With this new badge set, SAP Community is once again acknowledging the awesome members who regularly contribute quality content. And we‚Äôre not stopping here! In the near future, we plan to introduce other progression sets. We don‚Äôt want to give away too much information just yet ‚Äì we thought it would be fun to keep things a surprise ‚Äì but we do encourage you to get more active, as you may find yourself receiving bigger badge payoffs very soon.

Make sure to monitor the What‚Äôs New section for announcements about the new progression badge sets as they become available. In the meantime, if you frequently participate in the community, keep up the good work. Or if you‚Äôre more of a lurker, consider jumping in and building up the numbers necessary for badges. Depending on what you do (and what you‚Äôve done), you may find yourself the recipient of several shiny new badges as we extend the ways in which we show appreciation for those who make our community a better place!

OK, one hint: We aren‚Äôt just going to reward the members active in Q&A, so if answering questions isn‚Äôt your thing, you can still gain badges for other activities. Experiment with meaningful contributions, show your support for other members, and see what happens!

entry.title: In IAS, rehired users have wrong employee number / manager / employment data
entry.content:
Hi there,

We use IAS/IPS for authentication for SuccessFactors Employee Central. 

We have an issue for records for rehired employees in IAS. 

The person details for the employees are correct from SuccessFactors, but the employment details are incorrect and picking up from the original employment, rather than the existing employment details.

I have tested this by deleting the original User record from IAS, and watching as it recreates initially with the correct employment and then is over written with the previous employment details.

I can't see a way to exclude previous employments via the filters.  I don't want to exclude inactive employees as this would impact on future new hires as we have processes that set new passwords for these employees in advance of their hire date. 

Is there a way to manage this?

Thanks

entry.title: Re: Ariba - SLP and Buying and Invoicing - are there WSDL...

Thank you , Chuma, for your detailed reply! Sorry, I'm still new to the SAP world so hit the enter key out of habit üôÇ

Do you know specifically which web services there are? The ones we need i have not seen ever in any of the locations you suggested

We need: SLP:

User
User Groups
Supplier Data - i.e questionnaire answers when onboarding suppliers (We are currently using Supplier Data w/Pagination API)
Approval automation (We are currently using the External Approval API)
The ability to monitor the automations programmatically versus still needing someone to check thru the interface to make sure they are finishing successfully.

Buying and Invoicing:
All accounting string segments
Account Combinations
Users
Supplier
Supplier Location
Remittance Location
Chooser Helper File
Addresses
Flex Master Data (this is the main one causing us grief...we have several custom fields that needs to be repopulated at least every 5 minutes)
Relation Entries

I do not have the path you mentioned to see the steps, nor do i have Application Integration.
I do have Core Administration>Integration Manager>Integration Configuration.
There are 28 web services listed there, enabled and disabled, but none of them pertain to any of the master data that I need.
Thank you!!!

entry.title: Re: Clear Salary outside HireDate and TerminationDate ranges, and calculate per day salary
entry.content:
So I split the code into two and it works now

CONFIG.HIERARCHY.INCLUDE_MEMBERS_NOT_IN_HIERARCHY = [d/Account], [d/CostCenter], [d/Emp_Status], [d/Employee], [d/LegalEntity], [d/Location]
CONFIG.GENERATE_UNBOOKED_DATA = ON

MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "Amount_LC"
MEMBERSET [d/Account] = "ACC_017"
MEMBERSET [d/DataSource] = "DS_PAYROLL"
MEMBERSET [d/Employee] = (BASEMEMBER([d/Employee].[h/EmpStatus], "ACTIVE", "TERMINATED", "TO_BE_HIRED", "INACTIVE"))

// Hire Date Proration
IF DATEDIFF([d/HireDate], [d/Date], "MONTH") < 0 THEN
    DATA([d/Account] = "ACC_017", [d/Measures] = "Amount_LC", [d/DataSource] = "DS_PAYROLL") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "Amount_LC") * 0
ELSE
    IF DATEDIFF([d/HireDate], [d/Date], "DAY") < 0 THEN
        DATA([d/Account] = "ACC_017", [d/Measures] = "Amount_LC", [d/DataSource] = "DS_PAYROLL") =
            (1 - ABS(DATEDIFF([d/HireDate], [d/Date], "DAY")) / DAYSINMONTH([d/Date])) * RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "Amount_LC")
    ELSE
        // Full month if hired before this month
        DATA([d/Measures] = "Amount_LC") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "Amount_LC")
    ENDIF
ENDIF

Here is the code for reference, Thanks @William_Yu1 and @Chuma for trying to help me.

entry.title: Calling SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud APIs from SAP Integration Suite with OAuth 2.0
entry.content:
Hi all,

I can connect from SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration) to S/4HANA Public Cloud APIs using Basic Authentication, but I‚Äôd like to switch to OAuth 2.0 for better security.

When I try to set up a communication system/arrangement, the only inbound OAuth option I see is OAuth 2.0 (Public Client, PKCE). I don‚Äôt see OAuth 2.0 Identity Provider (which I would normally expect for certificate-based SAML Bearer Assertion).

So far:

  • Basic Auth works fine.

  • I created a key pair in CPI keystore and uploaded the cert to S/4, but inbound OAuth user creation still only shows PKCE.

  • Customers are asking for a more secure approach than Basic Auth.

My questions:

  1. Is OAuth2 SAML Bearer Assertion officially supported for inbound calls to S/4HANA Public Cloud from Integration Suite?

  2. If so, how do I enable the Identity Provider option in inbound communication users? Is it tenant-specific?

  3. If not, what is the best practice today for securing these integrations beyond Basic Auth?

Thanks in advance for clarifications or official references.

entry.title: Re: What's the best way to see material stock and history...
entry.content:
Hi Marcelo

Have you considered exploring the built-in Analytics available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

For example, the Inventory Analysis Overview (https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/index.html#/detail/Apps('F3366')/S35)

Or Analyze Stock in Range

The section in the Help covering Inventory Analytics and Control covers a number of other available apps and analytics like Goods Movement Analysis, Dead Stock, Inventory Turnover, etc. 

To directly answer your question, you can utilize the View Browser to search on the table name, but you may find a consumption table that is not released, or the table is represented by several views.

There likely will not be a 1:1 view for each table

If you can let us know more about your business requirement, we might be able to better answer your question or point you in the right direction.

Thank you

Jerry

entry.title: Re: CDS Hierarchy Directory: How to use NOTASSIGNEDNODE Annotation to suppress or to filter the Not
entry.content:
Hi 

you can try  @AnalyticsDetails.query.hierarchySettings.childNodePosition: #ABOVE to specify child node  position to upwards.

 

and Following is the table defination for zoq_connid_hd -

@EndUserText.label : 'Hierarchy directory for ConnectionID (SFLIGHT)'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #ALLOWED
define table zoq_connid_hd {

  key hieid    : zoq_conhieid not null;
  hiertxt      : rstxtlg;
  last_changed : rstimestmp;

}

I hope it helps.

entry.title: SAP Integration Suite - Operations ‚Äì A Structured Blog Series
entry.content:
This blog series is designed to provide a structured overview of operational best practices within SAP Integration Suite. It aims to support in establishing transparency, stability, and modernization across integration landscapes. Each entry focuses on a specific operational domain, offering actionable guidance for sustainable Integration Suite management. 

When it comes to operational best practices, several key areas are particularly relevant for ensuring a smooth, efficient, and scalable integration landscape.
The following aspects have been identified as key priorities, and this series aims to provide targeted guidance for each, including best practices from daily consulting business.*

*The current selection is based on our daily challenges and requests. We reserve the right to expand the scope with additional topics or adjust priorities as needed. Miss something ‚Äì say something. 

 

AreaSummary and IntentionLink
Architecture and Setup
  • Tenant Landscape (Account Setup according to BTP Guidance Framework)
  • tbd.
tbd. 
Security and Compliance
  • User Role Management: Establish a clear authorization model, assigning roles such as Developer, AMS, and others.
  • Authentication & Authorization
  • Access Policies
  • Security Monitoring (Leverage tools like SAP Enterprise Threat Detection to track audit and access logs, ensuring compliance and traceability)
  1. Streamlining User Management
  2. ...
 

Lifecycle Management

  • CI/CD for Integration Suite (Maintain version control for integration artifacts and automate deployments across environments (CI/CD))
  • Version Control
  • Integration Suite API's
tbd. 

Change Management & Quality Assurance

  • SAP Cloud Transport Management (Establish a structured transport mechanism using SAP Cloud Transport Management Service (CTMS).)
  • SAP Integration Suite - Naming Conventions
  • SAP Integration Suite Design Guidelines
tbd.

Monitoring and Troubleshooting

  • Message monitoring (iFlows, APIs, adapters, SAP Application Interface Framework (AIF))
  • Alerting setup (email, webhook, SAP Alert Notification Service)
  • Integration with SAP Cloud ALM or external tools
  • Implement detailed logging and trace capabilities for root cause analysis e.g. known Error Database
tbd. 
Miscellaneous Topics
  • Interface Repository (Setting up a centralized interface repository, e.g., with LeanIX or a tool of your choice)
  • SAP Integration Suite Ai capabilities
  • SAP Integration Suite Expert Portal
  • ...
tbd.

Join the Conversation 

SAP Integration Suite is redefining enterprise integration by breaking down silos and connecting diverse systems across the business. Whether you're managing an SAP-centric landscape or a hybrid IT environment, its 360-degree Suite approach offers a comprehensive toolset for end-to-end integration and drives business innovation.

We‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts and experiences with SAP Integration Suite. What challenges are you facing? How can we help you unlock the full potential of your IT ecosystem? 

Feel free to use the comment section or reach out to us via SAP Integration Services.

Modernize. Integrate. Innovate. 

History & What's New:
DateUpdate
  • 2025.08.08
  • Initial Version & Kick-Off 
  • Blogs: added User Management by @FrederickDimmer

Krzysztof

entry.title: Re: What's the best way to see material stock and history...
entry.content:
Greetings @marceloromeiro !

 

For a list of available CDS view related to Stock and Material Documents, I highly recommend checking the information present in the following section of the help portal:

CDS Views for Stock and Material Documents | SAP Help Portal

There, you can review which CDS view fits best for your business requirements!

 

 

Additionally, In S/4 Hana Cloud ERP, there is an app called Stock - Single Material (App ID: F1076), which, in its functionalities, include:

 

  • Display a stock overview of a single material.

  • Compare the stock information with the safety stock and minimum safety stock values defined for the material.

  • Detailed stock history for each plant or storage location for the last 11 periods (period-end closing) and the stock balance at the reporting date.

 

The stock history is structured as an interactive chart that allows you to analyze it in a visual way.

To review a stock, first select a material. The app displays your stock of the material by plant and by storage location as a table. It displays the stock history of the last 11 calendar months and the current stock in a curve diagram. The app uses today‚Äôs date as the reporting date. You can change the reporting date. If you leave the Reporting Date field empty, the system displays the stock of material for the current period (end of period).  To display your stock by plant and by storage location in a bar diagram, choose the graphical view.

The Stock History column or some stock types might be hidden. In the personalization area, you can specify the columns that you want the system to display in the results list. You access the stock history of all visible stock in the table by clicking on the micro chart.

 

If you wish to get an analysis of multiple materials, check app Stock - Multiple Materials (App ID: F1595), which contains information such as:

  • Advanced Search Capabilities

    Various filter options for searching large amounts of data specifically for the required materials. With these filter options you can better investigate your active materials (that is, for which goods movements have taken place) and materials without a deletion indicator in more detail.

  • Display a stock overview of one or multiple materials.

  • Display the value of your stock.

  • Display additional storage location information, for example, storage bin.

  • Display the carbon footprint of the materials in your plant.

The app calculates the stock values based on the stock quantity of the selected reporting date multiplied by the current material price. This means that the app always calculates using the current material price, irrespective of the reporting date you have selected. This calculation method for the stock value is common to all Fiori apps in Inventory Management.

In addition, in the Stock - Multiple Materials app, you can display the result of a calculation method based on the historical prices at the time of the related material postings.

Note that these two calculation methods lead to different results. SAP recommends that you use the main calculation method based on the current material price, because this method leads to faster results and is optimized for stock analysis.

 

I highly recommend checking the documentation for both applications for additional information regarding this subject:

Stock - Single Material app:

Stock - Single Material | SAP Help Portal

Stock - Multiple Materials app:

Stock - Multiple Materials | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Re: How Other VAT Reg. No. is determined in Billing?
entry.content:
Additional VAT numbers in KNAS-STCEG (e.g., NL‚Ä¶, FR‚Ä¶) via the ‚ÄúOther‚Äù button in the customer master are valid for cross-border transactions where the customer is registered in multiple EU countries but does not have separate addresses.

Let us say an example - Your customer is based in Germany (main VAT: DE‚Ä¶). They‚Äôre also VAT-registered in the Netherlands and France (NL‚Ä¶, FR‚Ä¶). You ship goods to NL or FR, but the customer doesn‚Äôt have a separate Ship-to address there. In this case, you don‚Äôt need to create new Ship-to customers for NL or FR. You simply maintain the NL and FR VAT numbers in KNAS-STCEG, and configure SAP to select the correct one based on the destination country.

entry.title: Export Software Collection in a Public Cloud environment fails after upgrade
entry.content:
I need to export one change to an BRF+ Application to our TST environment. I chose the option "CHANGED AND DELETED ITEMS". Due to the recent upgrade of Public Cloud to 2508, all items will be exported  

The export ends in an error message without extra information. It says 'Export Failed' but there is no detail information about why it failed. There are no other errors or warnings in the log. 

 

I have also tried to create a hotfix for the specific BRF+ change that I need to transport, but this hotfix has the same export error. 

I have also tried to activate the BRF+ application as a whole (mass change) again and then try to release but this also doesn't help.

I checked in Eclipse and found the Transport that was created by SAP.  If found this transportlog that maybe indicates that the lock cannot be set by SAP or that a lock is still active. 

 

How can I solve this problem? Is there a log somewhere that I can't see? What could be the issue?

Regards,

Ben Meijs

entry.title: Golf Member & Friendsturnier
entry.content:
Einladung zum Golf-Erlebnistag beim GCE

Liebe Kolleginnen und Kollegen,

die Mitglieder des GCE laden herzlich dazu ein, Familie, Freunde und Nachbarn zu einem gemeinsamen Golferlebnis mitzubringen.

Geplant ist eine kurze Einf√ºhrung durch einen professionellen Trainer, gefolgt von einem lockeren Spiel √ºber einige Bahnen ‚Äì ideal auch f√ºr Einsteiger*innen ohne Vorkenntnisse.

Im Anschluss freuen wir uns auf ein gem√ºtliches Beisammensein im Clubhaus mit einer kleinen Siegerehrung.

Wir freuen uns √ºber zahlreiche Teilnehmende und einen gelungenen Tag auf dem Golfplatz!

entry.title: Re: What's the best way to see material stock and history...
entry.content:
Hi Marcelo!


I see, in this case, i highly suggest checking the CDS view options available in the SAP Help portal under:

  •  Virtual Data Model and CDS Views in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition -> CDS Views | SAP Help Portal

Specifically for your use case, I suggest checking the options available in the link attached in my previous message under:

  • CDS Views for Supply Chain -> CDS Views for Inventory Management -> CDS Views for Stock and Material Documents | SAP Help Portal

 

For any other enquiries, feel free to post it here!

entry.title: Behavior When 'Public Project' is Set to No in Customer Projects
entry.content:
***Image/data in this Blog is from SAP internal systems, sample data, or demo systems. Any resemblance to real data is purely coincidental.***

Over the past few years, we've received numerous inquiries about the behavior of setting 'Public Project' to No within a customer project in the "Plan Customer Projects" app. To address these questions, I conducted a test on our internal system using version CE2508 and have documented the observed behavior below.

Scenario 1:

User A: role SAP_BR_PROJECT_MANAGER_PROF is assigned without any restrictions.
User B: role SAP_BR_PROJECT_MANAGER_PROF is assigned without any restrictions.

User A creates a customer project CLCP202507 and sets 'Public Project' to No, meaning it is a private project.
When User B logs into the system, he is able to see and edit the private customer project, despite not being assigned any role within the project.

 

Scenario 2:

User A: role SAP_BR_PROJECT_MANAGER_PROF is assigned without any restrictions.
User B: role ZSAP_BR_PROJECT_MANAGER_PROF_DIA is assigned, set restriction on  'Confidential Project' as N under Project part for Read authorization. See below.

The same private customer project CLCP202507 and User B is not assigned as any role in the project.
When User B logs into the system, he is not able to see the private customer project, even when conducting a direct search using the project ID. Only the public project is displayed. See below.


Scenario 3:

With the same settings in the customer project and business roles as scenario 2.
Assign user B as Project Controller in private customer project CLCP202507.

User B logs in the system and is able to view both the private project and the public projects. See below.

entry.title: Adding employee to Employee Central without an e-mail
entry.content:
Scenario:

A Customer uses Paradox ATS and Onboarding ‚Äì not using SAP Recruiting or Onboarding.

They then need that employee to be added to Core HR employee central and the other SFSF modules. Can they be added without an e-mail? i.e. can they sign in with a phone number as a username and access the system that way? Or with a dummy e-mail address, not validate it, but use it as a username, set a password, and access the system on a mobile device?

Is there a similar workaround for Recruiting and/or Onboarding?

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: How Other VAT Reg. No. is determined in Billing?
entry.content: Yes, this is indeed the case I described. However, the question was how to (re)direct the destination country to obtain the correct VAT Reg. No. from the additional ones. I‚Äôve just found the solution - in this case, the 'Tax dest. country' should be set accordingly in the Sales Order header -> 'Billing document' tab, e.g. to NL, to determine the NL... VAT Reg. No.

entry.title: Re: How Can We Consume Standard APIs With Business Users...
entry.content:
Hi @ItsMeGopi ,

I am adding on top of @Chuma 's good answer.

It might be easy to understand this question using an analogy: in the on-premise world, business users need to access data from another system. He/she asks the IT department to build an integration to that system. After the integration is done, he/she accesses the data without knowledge how this is done. Fast forward to the current cloud world, we use API to build the integration between systems. The business users only need to give the requirement, IT guy (if still exists) builds the integration using API. Afterwards he/she just access the data like it is on the current cloud system, but should not need to say let me roll up the sleeves to dig a channel or build a bridge to get data from other system. 

In essence, the business users give the requirement and IT guys build the infrastructure to make it happening. API is the new tools IT guys use in the cloud world.

Regards,

George

entry.title: LMS: prevent users from starting courses they already completed (in curricula requirements)
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a functional SAP LMS question:

I have a curriculum with curriculum requirement (number of hours of an item pool). The pool contains three online items. After completing the item, I still get the option to "start course", while the item is already completed. Once selected, I"m warned that I already completed it. Is there a way to hide this "start course" button after someone completed it?

The same question goes for items in the library: is there a way to prevent that users can restart (online) courses that they already completed?

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: Running T-code miro, how should i set the DRSEG-SGTXT value automatically
entry.content:
Use BTE : FI_BTE_PROCESS_00001120 and write the code in BTE like below;

LOOP AT t_bsegsub ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL ' <lfs_bsegsub>'.
   ' <lfs_bsegsub>'-sgtxt =  'Default Text'.
  ENDLOOP.

entry.title: Re: Urgent. I need to update SGTXT in MIRO Transaction.
entry.content:
Use BTE : FI_BTE_PROCESS_00001120 and write the code in BTE like below;

LOOP AT t_bsegsub ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL ' <lfs_bsegsub>'.
   ' <lfs_bsegsub>'-sgtxt =  'Default Text'.
  ENDLOOP.

entry.title: Error : (F5 263) The difference is too large for clearing in EBS in t code FF_5
entry.content:
Hi All

we are using SAP ECC system 

when we try to upload bank statement we are getting error as Error: (F5 263) The difference is too large for clearing in EBS in t code FF_5, and each time we have to approve manually in FEBAN

Note: there is check of automatic clearing in OT83 transaction

Wrong Interpretation Algorithm for clearing.
Ranges "From [ ] to [ ]" in BELNR/XBLNR may not be complete;
Date of statement may be earlier than the check date;
Opening Balance (+ Debits, - Credits) may be different from the closing balance.
Tolerances
House bank and bank key is also maintained

there cannot be currency issue because we only operate in USA and so currency is USD only

I have checked everything and seems to fine but issue persist, please share your thoughts on this

Regards

Jithendra Shivashankar

entry.title: Re: Using class CL_ABAP_PARALLEL for mass parallel dialog work processes
entry.content:
So I'm starting using it on my test system, when trying to steer up a little bit,  I reach rapidly the maximum ressources available. Wich is not my real problem...

My issue is that the main work process stay stuck with status 'Back-End Session in PRIV Mode' and when I look at SM21 :

Dispatching changed due to resource usage (Resource=ES MEMORY, Limit=60.000 %, Curr.=87.709 %)
High resource usage ascertained (Resource=ES MEMORY, Limit=90.000 %, Curr.=96.089 %)
Snapshot 1 created; reason: Many (warn limit exceeded) ES Memory (96.089 %) allocated
Dispatching changed due to resource usage (Resource=ES MEMORY, Limit=60.000 %, Curr.=84.916 %)

So I understand that I overexeeded my ressources üòÑ but on a real system how could I anticipate this ? And furthermore not stay stuck in PRIV mode T_T.

I tried to clear most of the data used by each tasks and not retrieving most of it to main process but still freezing.

Any ideas ?

@Sandra_Rossi maybe ? üôÇ

entry.title: No e-mail notification from SAC calendar tasks when the owner and the assignee are one and the same?
entry.content:
Dear experts, 

In SAP analytics cloud calendar we created a task with owner and assignee one and the same user. 
There is no notification received when the task was activated. For other tasks the same user received notifications , but in case the owner and the assignee are one the same, there is no notification. Is this how the system is designed to work or this is a bug?

Is there a workaround to receive notification?

 

thank you!

entry.title: Filter 'Status' is missing in 'Manage Service Quotations' app
entry.content:
Dear team,

We have the requirement to filter our service quotations by its status, however it's not possible to filter by the status on the app 'Manage Service Quotations' as the filter for this field is not available by default and neither to add on additional filters.

How can I do it?

Best regards.

 

 

 

One thing I wanted to add, if I choose the component CRM-S4-SRV-SVQ-2CL for this Ticket, it is not possible to report is as a regression issue. This is why I chose: CRM-S4-SRV-SVO-2CL 


--- Steps to Reproduce ---

You can use this CB-User for testing: CBPHONE_NUMBER.

  1. Open the app "manage service quotation"
  2. Click on "Adapt Filters"
  3. Search for "Status" / This field is now gone since Update DIGITS. Here it was possible to filter all "accepted", all "open", all "rejected", or all "sent to customer" quotations



*Note To SAP:
I give approval for SAP Support to use these Steps to Reproduce, while connected to my impacted non-production environments, even if the steps result in a change being made and my approval remains valid until the issue is resolved, unless I inform SAP Support otherwise.

--- Issue Date (UTC) ---
DIGITS-08-18 05:00:00


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Filter 'Status' is missing in 'Manage Service Quotati...
entry.content:
Hello,

The app 'Manage Service Quotations' have an embedded filter by status, which separates the service quotations into four different lists:

  • All (no status filter)
  • Open / Under Review
  • Sent to Customer
  • Accepted / Rejected

Withing those lists, you can use additional filters to get your desired listing.

Kind regards.

entry.title: Re: Adding employee to Employee Central without an e-mail
entry.content: You do not need an email address to add an employee to Employee Central. What needs to be assessed is how do your users log into EC?  I assume they are using IAS?  In that case they need a unique email address, this can be a dummy one.  However, IAS will send the account set up email to the email address provided, so the email will not be sent,  so you would need a manual workaround.  The value of the username does not have to be the email address it can be a numerical number.  Also how are they dealing with MFA and will the dummy email impact MFA?

entry.title: Data Action to copy from classic model to new model
entry.content:
Hi,

The following data action to copy data from a classic model to new model has errors below. How do I resolve the errors for a working solution?

DATA("SignedData", [d/Date, d/Version, d/GL_ACCOUNT, d/AUDIT_TRAIL, d/BUSINESS_STREAM, d/DEPARTMENT, d/LOCATION, d/SUPPLIER, d/ASSET,d/CAPEX,d/CUSTOMER,d/COMPANY])
= LINK([FINANCE], [d/Date=%pDate%, d/Version=%pVersion%,d/GL_ACCOUNT,d/AUDIT_TRAIL,d/BUSINESS_STREAM,d/DEPARTMENT, d/LOCATION, d/SUPPLIER, d/ASSET,d/CAPEX,d/CUSTOMER,d/COMPANY], "Measures")

1. Mismatching 'SignedData'; expecting ')'

2. Mismatching input ','; expecting '='

Thanks,

Rajash

entry.title: CodeJam Request Barcelona- 2 October 2025
entry.content:
Hi SAP Advocates,

  The 2nd of October we will organize our annual convention about technical topics around SAP, we call it "Code10 Tech Talks" and we would like to host a CodeJam session from SAP as part of the event.

  The idea is host the CodeJam in the morining in the same place where we do the event, it has capacity for 25/30 spots, and we will cover the place, some breakfast and lunch for the ones that will stay in the evening for the expositions.

  All the event is about Tech around SAP, so Integration, Automation, development, etc..

  About the topic we are very open to any suggestion for the CodeJam

  Contact: antonio.valladares@code10it.com

entry.title: Goal & Development plan dates
entry.content:
Hi

We have a few different groups using goal plans at our organization. Some have a different performance year than others. Before with the legacy goal plan all of the groups could use the same goal plan and set dates from their goals without it matching the template goal plan dates. With the new goal plan that doesn't seem to be possible anymore.

The only solution I could get to work is is duplicating goal plans with the only different being the goal plan start and end dates. Are there any other solutions to consider? Can you set a default date for your template that is different than the start date in the template configuration?

entry.title: Re: What's the best way to see material stock and history...
entry.content: Ok, maybe Material Stock at Posting Date (https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/c0c54048d35849128be8e872df5bea6d/4b7d68579552346ae10000000a4450e5.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US) or you may use that one plus some other to create your own CDS View. It is meant to answer the question "What was my total stock on a specified date?". As you are exporting the data, I would recommend one of the Extraction views if possible - often they would support CDC (Change Data Capture) or Delta requests, but your middleware needs to support that functionality (like BW) - there are several blogs here about extracting data via CDS View in the community. thank you, Jerry
